concise_definition: v. 跳过, 跳过不做, 跳跃; n. 跳跃, 跳绳

definitions.explanation_en: To deliberately avoid or omit something, especially a part of a task, event, or sequence, often because it is considered unnecessary, unpleasant, or unimportant.
definitions.explanation_cn: 故意避开或省略某事物，尤其是任务、事件或序列中的一部分，通常是因为认为其不必要、不愉快或不重要。
definitions.example_en: I decided to skip breakfast this morning because I was in a hurry.
definitions.example_cn: 今天早上我因为赶时间，决定不吃早餐。

definitions.explanation_en: To move by hopping or leaping, typically with both feet leaving the ground at the same time, often in a light or playful manner.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过跳跃或蹦跳的方式移动，通常双脚同时离地，动作轻快或带有玩耍性质。
definitions.example_en: The children were skipping rope in the schoolyard.

definitions.explanation_en: To fail to attend or be present at something, especially an appointment, class, or event.
definitions.explanation_cn: 未能出席或参加某事，尤指约会、课程或活动。
definitions.example_en: He skipped class again yesterday and got in trouble with the teacher.
definitions.example_cn: 他昨天又逃课了，被老师训了一顿。

definitions.explanation_en: A single hop or leap, especially in the context of children's play or physical activity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一次跳跃或蹦跳，尤其用于描述儿童游戏或体育活动中的动作。
definitions.example_en: She gave a joyful skip as she ran toward the park.
definitions.example_cn: 她一边跑向公园，一边欢快地跳跃着。

comparison.analysis: “Omit” (省略) 更正式，强调在记录、写作或程序中因有意或无意而未包含某内容，通常不带有情感色彩或行为动作。而 “skip” 更口语化，常暗示主动选择跳过，有时带有轻率或逃避的意味，如跳过课程或任务。
“Jump” (跳跃) 是更通用的物理动作词，指双脚离地的任何向上或向前的弹跳，不一定是轻快或重复性的。而 “skip” 作为动词时，特指一种轻盈、有节奏的跳跃，常用于儿童游戏或描述愉悦的移动方式，如跳绳或边走边跳。
“Avoid” (避免) 强调主动避开危险、麻烦或不愉快的事物，通常是为了防止负面后果，语义更侧重于防范。而 “skip” 更中性，可以用于无害的场合，如跳过一段无聊的视频，不一定涉及风险或威胁。
